description:
Speaker: Roman Yurchak

Track:PyData
In this  we talk present how to write Python extensions in Rust, and discusse advantages and limitation of such approach.  We then illustrate this approach on the vtext project, that aims to be a high-performance library for text processing.

Recorded at the PyConDE & PyData Berlin 2019 conference.
https://pycon.de

More details at the conference page: https://de.pycon.org/program/ALRGXS
Twitter:  https://twitter.com/pydataberlin
Twitter:  https://twitter.com/pyconde
title: vtext: text processing in Rust with Python bindings
